alert.note: Alert for La Salle; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 7:14AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Localized flooding of low-lying areas caused by rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Livingston. In north central Illinois, La Salle. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated steady rain with rain rates of one half to one inch per hour. - The rain will continue this morning with the heaviest rates near one inch per hour in southern LaSalle and western Livingston counties. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Ottawa, Streator, Pontiac, Peru, La Salle, Marseilles, Dwight, Oglesby, Seneca, North Utica, Forrest, Flanagan, Odell, South Streator, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Naplate, Cornell, Saunemin and Dayton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
